summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 2, 2019, discussing the immediate aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's indictment in the Southern District of New York. It outlines the urgent operational plans for his arrest upon return to the U.S., execution of a search warrant at his NYC residence, interviews with co-conspirators, and deployment of agents to Florida to serve subpoenas.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the indictment and arrest warrant. The email states he was indicted in SDNY and a warrant for his arrest has been issued. He is believed to be in France at the time of the email.

persons.name: SSA - FBI New York
persons.context: The primary author/coordinator of the email, requesting availability from squad members for urgent investigative actions related to Epstein's arrest and investigation.

connections.description: The SSA is coordinating the law enforcement response to arrest and investigate Epstein following his indictment.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York and an arrest warrant was issued. He is believed to be in France at the time.

events.title: FBI Plans Arrest and Search
events.description: The FBI squad C-20 (VCAC/Human Trafficking) is placed on standby to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida to serve subpoenas.

locations: France (where Epstein is believed to be)
New York City, NY (location of Epstein's residence to be searched)
Florida (location for serving subpoenas and interviewing individuals)
Southern District of New York (SDNY) (jurisdiction of indictment)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York on July 2, 2019, and an arrest warrant was issued.
At the time of the email, Epstein was believed to be in France, and the FBI planned to arrest him immediately upon his return to the United States.
The FBI's Squad C-20 (VCAC/Human Trafficking) was tasked with executing a search warrant at Epstein's New York City residence and interviewing co-conspirators.
The plan included deploying two agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and attempt to interview 1-3 individuals.
The operational planning was urgent and required the entire squad to be on standby, as Epstein's return timing was unknown.
